text.0: agni and soma mighty pair graciously hearken to my call.
text.1: accept in friendly wise my hymn and prosper him who offers gifts.
text.2: the man who honours you today agni and soma with this hymn.
text.3: bestow on him heroic strength increase of kine and noble steeds.
text.4: the man who offers holy oil and burnt oblations unto you.
text.5: agni and soma shall enjoy great strength with offspring all his life.
text.6: agni and soma famed is that your prowess wherewith ye stole the kine his food from paṇi.
text.7: ye caused the brood of bṛsaya to perish ye found the light the single light for many.
text.8: agni and soma joined in operation ye have set up the shining lights in heaven.
text.9: from curse and from reproach agni and soma ye freed the rivers that were bound in fetters.
text.10: one of you mātariśvan brought from heaven the falcon rent the other from the mountain.
text.11: strengthened by holy prayer agni and soma have made us ample room for sacrificing.
text.12: taste agni soma this prepared oblation accept it mighty ones and let it please you.
text.13: vouchsafe us good protection and kind favour grant to the sacrificer health and riches.
text.14: whoso with oil and poured oblation honours with goddevoted heart agni and soma.
text.15: protect his sacrifice preserve him from distress grant to the sacrificer great felicity.
text.16: invoked together mates in wealth agnisoma accept our hymns.
text.18: agni and soma unto him who worships you with holy oil.
text.20: agni and soma be ye pleased with these oblations brought to you.
text.21: and come together nigh to us.
text.22: agni and soma cherish well our horses and let our cows be fat who yield oblations.
text.23: grant power to us and to our wealthy patrons and cause our holy rites to be successful.
